00079 void CNAnalysisMethodCN::setEngine(BaseEngine* p)
00080 {
00081   AffxString str;
00082   m_pEngine = p;
00083   for (unsigned int i = 0; (i < m_vCNState.size()); i++)
00084     {
00085       if (i > 0) {str += ",";}
00086       str += ::getInt(m_vCNState[i]);
00087     }
00088   p->setOpt("hmmCN_state", str);
00089   str = "";
00090   for (unsigned int i = 0; (i < m_vMu.size()); i++)
00091     {
00092       if (i > 0) {str += ",";}
00093       if (i == 1)
00094       {
00095           if ((m_pEngine->isOptDefined("cyto2")) && (m_pEngine->getOptBool("cyto2")))
00096           {
00097             if (i == 1) {m_pEngine->setOpt("yTarget", ToStr(m_vMu[i]));}
00098           }
00099           else
00100           {
00101             m_pEngine->setOpt("yTarget", "-0.56747");
00102           }
00103       }
00104       str += ::getDouble(m_vMu[i], 6);
00105     }
00106   p->setOpt("hmmCN_mu",  str);
00107 }

00152 {
00153   std::vector<SelfDoc::Opt> opts;
00154 
00155   // SelfDoc::Opt(name, type, value, default, min, max, description)
00156

00158   opts.push_back(hmmCN_state);
00159

00161   opts.push_back(hmmCN_prior_prob);
00162 
00163   // gc-correction false = -2,-0.552,0,0.339,0.543

00204 /**
00205  * @brief This static function should be overridden by child classes
00206  * to return an object of the correct type initialized correctly
00207  * with the parameters in the string, string map. All objects
00208  * created this way should be deleted when finished using.
00209  *
00210  * @param param - Map of key/value pairs to initialize the object.
00211  *
00212  * @return Pointer toCreate object, this should be sub casted as necessary.
00213  */
00214 SelfCreate* CNAnalysisMethodCN::newObject(std::map<std::string,std::string>& params)
00215 {
00216     SelfDoc doc = explainSelf();
00217     std::vector<SelfDoc::Opt> opts = getDefaultDocOptions();
00218     CNAnalysisMethodCN* pMethod = new CNAnalysisMethodCN();
00219     std::string strPrefix = getPrefix();
00220 
00221     AffxString str;
00222     AffxByteArray ba;
00223 
00224     str = setupStringParameter("hmmCN_state", strPrefix, params, doc, opts);
00225     ba.assign(str);
00226     ba.replace(",", " ");
00227     pMethod->m_vCNState.resize(ba.parameterCount());
00228     for (int iIndex = 1; (iIndex <= ba.parameterCount()); iIndex++)
00229     {
00230         pMethod->m_vCNState[iIndex - 1] = ba.getParameter(iIndex).parseInt();
00231     }
00232 
00233     str = setupStringParameter("hmmCN_prior_prob", strPrefix, params, doc, opts);
00234     ba.assign(str);
00235     ba.replace(",", " ");
00236     pMethod->m_vPriorProb.resize(ba.parameterCount());
00237     for (int iIndex = 1; (iIndex <= ba.parameterCount()); iIndex++)
00238     {
00239         pMethod->m_vPriorProb[iIndex - 1] = ba.getParameter(iIndex).parseDouble();
00240     }
00241 
00242     str = setupStringParameter("hmmCN_mu", strPrefix, params, doc, opts);
00243     ba.assign(str);
00244     ba.replace(",", " ");
00245     pMethod->m_vMu.resize(ba.parameterCount());
00246     for (int iIndex = 1; (iIndex <= ba.parameterCount()); iIndex++)
00247     {
00248         pMethod->m_vMu[iIndex - 1] = ba.getParameter(iIndex).parseDouble();
00249     }
00250 
00251     str = setupStringParameter("hmmCN_sigma", strPrefix, params, doc, opts);
00252     ba.assign(str);
00253     ba.replace(",", " ");
00254     pMethod->m_vSigma.resize(ba.parameterCount());
00255     for (int iIndex = 1; (iIndex <= ba.parameterCount()); iIndex++)
00256     {
00257         pMethod->m_vSigma[iIndex - 1] = ba.getParameter(iIndex).parseDouble();
00258     }
00259 
00260     pMethod->m_dTransMatDecay = setupDoubleParameter("hmmCN_TransitionDecay", strPrefix, params, doc, opts);
00261     pMethod->m_strStateEstMethod = setupStringParameter("hmmCN_StateEstimationMethod", strPrefix, params, doc, opts);
00262     pMethod->m_fwdOnly = setupIntParameter("hmmCN_ForwardOnly", strPrefix, params, doc, opts);
00263     pMethod->m_inormalStateMinObservations = setupIntParameter("hmmCN_NormalStateMinObservations", strPrefix, params, doc, opts);
00264     pMethod->m_iSmoothOutliers = setupIntParameter("hmmCN_SmoothOutliers", strPrefix, params, doc, opts);
00265     pMethod->m_transTypeStat = setupIntParameter("hmmCN_TransTypeStat", strPrefix, params, doc, opts);
00266     pMethod->m_uiEMIterations = setupIntParameter("hmmCN_EMIterations", strPrefix, params, doc, opts);
00267     pMethod->m_dEMConvergentThreshold = setupDoubleParameter("hmmCN_EMConvergenceThreshold", strPrefix, params, doc, opts);
00268     pMethod->m_iNormalState = setupIntParameter("hmmCN_NormalState", strPrefix, params, doc, opts);
00269     pMethod->m_iPostCNFitMaxOutlierRemoveRunSize = setupIntParameter("PostCNFitMaxOutlierRemoveRunSize", strPrefix, params, doc, opts);
00270 
00271     if (pMethod->m_vCNState.size() != pMethod->m_vPriorProb.size()) {throw(Except("PriorProb parameter must be the same size as the CNState parameter."));}
00272     if (pMethod->m_vCNState.size() != pMethod->m_vMu.size()) {throw(Except("Mu parameter must be the same size as the CNState parameter."));}
00273     if (pMethod->m_vCNState.size() != pMethod->m_vSigma.size()) {throw(Except("Sigma parameter must be the same size as the CNState parameter."));}
00274     double dSumPriorProb = 0;
00275     for (int iIndex = 0; (iIndex < (int)pMethod->m_vCNState.size()); iIndex++)
00276     {
00277         dSumPriorProb += pMethod->m_vPriorProb[iIndex];
00278         if (pMethod->m_vPriorProb[iIndex] <= 0) {throw(Except("PriorProb parameters must be greater than or equal to zero."));}
00279         if (pMethod->m_vSigma[iIndex] <= 0) {throw(Except("Sigma parameters must be greater than or equal to zero."));}
00280         if ((iIndex > 0) && (pMethod->m_vMu[iIndex - 1] > pMethod->m_vMu[iIndex])) {throw(Except("Mu parameters must be sorted and increasing in order."));}
00281     }
00282     for (int iIndex = 0; (iIndex < (int)pMethod->m_vPriorProb.size()); iIndex++)
00283     {
00284         pMethod->m_vPriorProb[iIndex] /= dSumPriorProb;
00285     }
00286     if (pMethod->m_iNormalState > (int)(pMethod->m_vCNState.size() - 1)) {throw(Except("Normal State parameter must be less than the number of CN States specified."));}
00287 
00288     return pMethod;
00289 }
00290 
00291 /**
00292  * @brief Run the analysis
00293  */
00294 void CNAnalysisMethodCN::run()
00295 {
00296     isSetup();
00297 
00298     int iLastChromosome = getProbeSets()->at(getProbeSets()->size() - 1)->getChromosome();
00299     int iLastAutosomeChromosome = getLastAutosomeChromosome();
00300     AffxMultiDimensionalArray<float> arAutosomeMedians(iLastAutosomeChromosome);
00301 //    Verbose::progressBegin(1, "CNAnalysisMethodCN::run(...) ", iLastChromosome, 1, iLastChromosome);
00302     for (int iChromosome = 1; (iChromosome <= iLastChromosome); iChromosome++)
00303     {
00304 //        Verbose::progressStep(1);
00305         int iProbeSetCount = getProbeSetCount(iChromosome, getProbeSets());
00306         if (iProbeSetCount > 0)
00307         {
00308             std::vector<int> vPositions(iProbeSetCount);
00309             std::vector<float> vLog2Ratios(iProbeSetCount);
00310             std::vector<int> vCNStates(iProbeSetCount);
00311             int iIndex = 0;
00312             for (int iProbeSetIndex = 0; (iProbeSetIndex < (int)getProbeSets()->size()); iProbeSetIndex++)
00313             {
00314                 CNProbeSet* pobjProbeSet = getProbeSets()->at(iProbeSetIndex);
00315                 if (pobjProbeSet->getChromosome() == iChromosome)
00316                 {
00317                     vPositions[iIndex] = pobjProbeSet->getPosition();
00318                     vLog2Ratios[iIndex] = pobjProbeSet->getLog2Ratio();
00319                     vCNStates[iIndex] = 0;
00320                     iIndex++;
00321                 }
00322             }
00323             std::vector<double> vDiagProb(5, 0.94);
00324             setup(true, true, true, true, (m_fwdOnly == 1), true, (m_transTypeStat == 1));
00325             diagProb(vDiagProb);
00326             std::vector<double> vStateMargProb; // unused output
00327             hmm(vPositions, vLog2Ratios, vCNStates, m_vPriorProb, m_vMu, m_vSigma, m_dTransMatDecay, m_strStateEstMethod, vStateMargProb, m_uiEMIterations, m_dEMConvergentThreshold, false, m_iNormalState);
00328             copyNumberStatePostProcessing(iChromosome, vLog2Ratios, vCNStates);
00329         }
00330     }
00331 //    Verbose::progressEnd(1, "Done");
00332 }
00333 
00334 /**
00335  * @brief Anneal the CN calls and load them into the CNProbeSet vector.
00336  * @param int - The chromosome to process.
00337  * @param std::vector<float>& - The log2 ration vector
00338  * @param std::vector<int>& - The CN calls vector
00339  */
00340 void CNAnalysisMethodCN::copyNumberStatePostProcessing(int iChromosome, std::vector<float>& vLog2Ratios, std::vector<int>& vCNStates)
00341 {
00342     if (m_iPostCNFitMaxOutlierRemoveRunSize == 1)
00343     {
00344         std::vector<int> vDiff((int)vLog2Ratios.size() - 1);
00345         for (int iIndex = 1; (iIndex < (int)vLog2Ratios.size()); iIndex++)
00346         {
00347             vDiff[iIndex - 1] = (vCNStates[iIndex] - vCNStates[iIndex - 1]);
00348         }
00349         for (int iIndex = 1; (iIndex < (int)vDiff.size()); iIndex++)
00350         {
00351             if ((vDiff[iIndex - 1] == -vDiff[iIndex]) && (vDiff[iIndex - 1] != 0))
00352             {
00353                 vCNStates[iIndex] = vCNStates[iIndex - 1];
00354             }
00355         }
00356     }
00357     int iIndex = 0;
00358     for (int iProbeSetIndex = 0; (iProbeSetIndex < (int)getProbeSets()->size()); iProbeSetIndex++)
00359     {
00360         CNProbeSet* pobjProbeSet = getProbeSets()->at(iProbeSetIndex);
00361         if (pobjProbeSet->getChromosome() == iChromosome)
00362         {
00363             pobjProbeSet->setCNState(vCNStates[iIndex]);
00364             iIndex++;
00365         }
00366     }
00367 }

00376   m_diagProb.clear();
00377   m_diagProb = dpvec;

00382 /**
00383  * @brief Compute the observed log-likelihoods 'aka' the emission probabilities.
00384  * @param samplr         - Sample log2 ratios.
00385  * @param sumState       - Number of states.
00386  * @param updated_mu     - Mean values per state.
00387  * @param updated_sigma  - standard deviation per state.
00388  * @param log_lik_obs    - Observed log likelihood.
00389  */
00390 void CNAnalysisMethodCN::obsloglik(
00391     //Input
00392     const VecCNLR&          samplr,
00393     const int             numState,
00394     const vector<double>&         updated_mu,
00395     const vector<double>&         updated_sigma,
00396     //Output
00397     vector< vector<double> >&     log_lik_obs
00398     )
00399 {
00400   // Initialization
00401   int numobs =     (int)samplr.size();         // Number of observed symbols
00402   double ln_sqrt_2pi =    log(sqrt(2*M_PI));
00403 
00404   //Verbose::out(3,"CNAnalysisMethodCN::hmm:obsloglik - Estimating Log Likelihood... ");
00405 
00406   for (int n = 0; n < numobs; n++) {
00407       for (int stateI = 0; stateI < numState; stateI++) {
00408         double dTMP = (samplr[n] - updated_mu[stateI])/updated_sigma[stateI];
00409         log_lik_obs[stateI][n] = -(ln_sqrt_2pi + log(updated_sigma[stateI]) +0.5 * (dTMP * dTMP));
00410         //Verbose::out(10,"CNAnalysisMethodCN::hmm:obsloglik - Observation: " + ToStr(n) + " state: " + ToStr(stateI) + " log_lik_obs : " + ToStr(log_lik_obs[stateI][n]));
00411       } //stateI
00412   } //numobs
00413 }
00414 
00415 /**
00416  * @brief Compute the forward log likelihood.
00417  * @param dist_covariate
00418  * @param log_priorProb         -
00419  * @param updated_log_priorProb -
00420  * @param log_lik_obs           -
00421  * @param transMatDecay         -
00422  * @param trans_type_stat       -
00423  * @param log_transmat_stat     -
00424  * @param alpha                 -
00425  * @param beta                  -
00426  * @param gamma                 -
00427  * @param gamma_state_sum       -
00428  * @param xi_sum                -
00429  * @param previous_loglik       -
00430  * @return The forward log likelihood.
00431  */
00432 double CNAnalysisMethodCN::fwdback(
00433     //Input
00434     const vector<double>&         dist_covariate,
00435     const vector<double>&         log_priorProb,
00436     const vector<double>&         updated_log_priorProb,
00437     const vector<vector<double> >&     log_lik_obs,
00438     const double                    transMatDecay,
00439     const bool                      trans_type_stat,
00440     const vector< vector<double> >& log_transmat_stat,
00441     //Output
00442     vector< vector<double> >&     alpha,
00443     vector< vector<double> >&     beta,
00444     vector< vector<double> >&     gamma,
00445     vector<double>&                 gamma_state_sum,
00446     vector< vector<double> >&     xi_sum,
00447     const double             previous_loglik
00448     )
00449 {
00450   // Initialization
00451   double decay_factor, log_decay_factor, prior_mult_exp_fn, trans_elem;
00452   int numobs =   (int)log_lik_obs[0].size();
00453   int numState = (int)log_lik_obs.size();
00454 
00455 
00456   //Verbose::out(3,"CNAnalysisMethodCN::hmm:fwdback - Computing forward-back coefficients... ");
00457   // Verbose::out(10,"CNAnalysisMethodCN::hmm:fwdback - fwd_only: " + ToStr(m_fwdOnly) +  " scaled: " + ToStr(m_scaled));
00458 
00459   //Error checking: Make sure sum(priors) =1
00460   double prior_sum = -FLT_MAX;
00461   for(int stateI = 0; stateI < numState; stateI++) {
00462     prior_sum = ADD_LOG_PROB(prior_sum, updated_log_priorProb[stateI]);
00463   }
00464   CNERR_CHECK((fabs(exp(prior_sum)-1)<1e-5),"CNAnalysisMethodCN::hmm:fwdback - Sum of priors: " + ToStr(exp(prior_sum)) + " does not equal 1");
00465 
00466   //Error checking: Make sure sum(transitions) = 1: only necessary in case of stationary transition matrix
00467   if (trans_type_stat) {
00468     for(int stateI = 0; stateI < numState; stateI++) {
00469       double trans_sum = -FLT_MAX;
00470       for(int stateJ = 0; stateJ < numState; stateJ++) {
00471         trans_sum = ADD_LOG_PROB(trans_sum, log_transmat_stat[stateI][stateJ]);
00472       }
00473       if(fabs(exp(trans_sum)-1)>1e-5) {
00474         for(int stateJ = 0; stateJ < numState; stateJ++) {
00475           //Verbose::out(3,"CNAnalysisMethodCN::hmm:fwdback: log_transmat_stat[" + ToStr(stateI) + "][" + ToStr(stateJ) + "] = " + ToStr(log_transmat_stat[stateI][stateJ]));
00476         }
00477         CNERR_CHECK((fabs(exp(trans_sum)-1)<1e-5),"CNAnalysisMethodCN::hmm:fwdback - Sum of transitions from state " + ToStr(stateI) + " is " + ToStr(exp(trans_sum)) + " and does not equal 1");
00478       }
00479     }
00480   }
00481 
00482   // Step A: FORWARD of fwdback
00483   // NOTE: Alpha/Beta/Gamma are stored in log space
00484   for(int stateI = 0; stateI < numState; stateI++) {
00485     // Step 1: Initialization of alpha
00486     alpha[stateI][0] = ADD_LOG_PROB(updated_log_priorProb[stateI], log_lik_obs[stateI][0]);
00487   }
00488 
00489   //Step 2-3: Induction & Termination
00490   for(int n = 1; n < numobs; n++) {
00491     log_decay_factor = -(1/transMatDecay)*dist_covariate[n-1];
00492     decay_factor = exp(log_decay_factor);
00493     for(int stateI = 0; stateI < numState; stateI++) {
00494       alpha[stateI][n] = -FLT_MAX;
00495       prior_mult_exp_fn = (m_updateTransMat) ? (updated_log_priorProb[stateI]+log(1-decay_factor)) : (log_priorProb[stateI]+log(1-decay_factor));
00496       for(int stateJ = 0; stateJ < numState; stateJ++) {
00497         if (trans_type_stat) {
00498           trans_elem = log_transmat_stat[stateJ][stateI];
00499         } else {
00500           trans_elem = prior_mult_exp_fn;
00501           if(stateJ == stateI) {
00502             trans_elem = ADD_LOG_PROB(trans_elem, log_decay_factor);
00503           }
00504         } // if-else trans_type_stat
00505         alpha[stateI][n] = ADD_LOG_PROB(alpha[stateI][n], alpha[stateJ][n-1] + trans_elem);
00506       } // stateJ
00507       alpha[stateI][n] += log_lik_obs[stateI][n];  // This term is a multiplier, so can happen outside of the loop over stateJ
00508     } // stateI
00509   } //numobs
00510 
00511   // Compute full log likelihood
00512   double fwd_loglik = -FLT_MAX;
00513   for(int stateI = 0; stateI < numState; stateI++) {
00514     fwd_loglik = ADD_LOG_PROB(fwd_loglik, alpha[stateI][numobs-1]);
00515   }
00516   //Verbose::out(10,"CNAnalysisMethodCN::hmm:fwdback - Log(Probability of the observation sequence given a model): " + ToStr(fwd_loglik));
00517 
00518 
00519   // Step B: BACKWARD of fwdback
00520   // Step 1: Initialization of beta
00521   for(int stateI = 0; stateI < numState; stateI++) {
00522     beta[stateI][numobs-1] = 0;
00523   } // stateI
00524 
00525   for(int stateI = 0; stateI < numState; stateI++) {
00526       //Verbose::out(10,"CNAnalysisMethodCN::hmm:fwdback(back) - Observation: " + ToStr(numobs-1) + ", state " + ToStr(stateI)  +  ", beta(scaled) = " + ToStr(beta[stateI][numobs-1]));
00527       //Verbose::out(10,"CNAnalysisMethodCN::hmm:fwdback(back) - Observation: " + ToStr(numobs-1) + ", state " + ToStr(stateI)  +  ", gamma(scaled) = " + ToStr(gamma[stateI][numobs-1]));
00528   } //stateI
00529 
00530   // Step 2 -3: Induction + Termination
00531   for(int n = numobs-2; n >=0; n--) {
00532     log_decay_factor = -(1/transMatDecay)*dist_covariate[n];
00533     decay_factor = exp(log_decay_factor);
00534     for(int stateI = 0; stateI < numState; stateI++) {
00535       beta[stateI][n] = -FLT_MAX;
00536       prior_mult_exp_fn = (m_updateTransMat) ? (updated_log_priorProb[stateI]+log(1-decay_factor)) : (log_priorProb[stateI]+log(1-decay_factor));
00537       for(int stateJ = 0; stateJ < numState; stateJ++) {
00538         if (trans_type_stat) {
00539           trans_elem = log_transmat_stat[stateI][stateJ];
00540         } else {
00541           trans_elem = prior_mult_exp_fn;
00542           if(stateJ == stateI) {
00543             trans_elem = ADD_LOG_PROB(trans_elem, log_decay_factor);
00544           }
00545         }
00546         beta[stateI][n] = ADD_LOG_PROB(beta[stateI][n], beta[stateJ][n+1] + trans_elem + log_lik_obs[stateJ][n]);
00547       } //stateJ
00548     } //stateI
00549   } //nobs
00550 
00551   // Compute gamma, gamma_sum & xi_sum
00552   vector< vector<double> > xi_temp(numState);
00553   for(int stateI = 0; stateI < numState; stateI++) {
00554     gamma_state_sum[stateI] = -FLT_MAX;
00555     xi_temp[stateI].resize(numState);
00556     for(int stateJ = 0; stateJ < numState; stateJ++) {
00557       xi_sum[stateI][stateJ] = -FLT_MAX;
00558     }
00559   }
00560   double min_gamma_sum=-FLT_MAX;
00561   double max_gamma_sum=-FLT_MAX;
00562   for(int n = 0; n < numobs; n++) {
00563     double gamma_sum = -FLT_MAX;
00564     for(int stateI = 0; stateI < numState; stateI++) {
00565       gamma[stateI][n] = alpha[stateI][n] + beta[stateI][n];
00566       gamma_sum = ADD_LOG_PROB(gamma_sum, gamma[stateI][n]);
00567     }
00568     if(n==0) {
00569       min_gamma_sum = max_gamma_sum = gamma_sum;
00570     } else {
00571       // A sanity-check on forward & backward algorithms - sum of gamma should be the same for every n
00572       if(gamma_sum > max_gamma_sum) {
00573         max_gamma_sum = gamma_sum;
00574       }
00575       if(gamma_sum < min_gamma_sum) {
00576         min_gamma_sum = gamma_sum;
00577       }
00578     }
00579     // Scale and sum the gammas
00580     for(int stateI = 0; stateI < numState; stateI++) {
00581       gamma[stateI][n] -= gamma_sum;
00582       gamma_state_sum[stateI] = ADD_LOG_PROB(gamma_state_sum[stateI], gamma[stateI][n]);
00583     }
00584 
00585     // Computation of xi is for the re-estimation component
00586     if(n < (numobs-1)) {
00587       double xi_scale_factor = -FLT_MAX;
00588       log_decay_factor = -(1/transMatDecay)*dist_covariate[n];
00589       decay_factor = exp(log_decay_factor);
00590       for(int stateI = 0; stateI < numState; stateI++) {
00591         prior_mult_exp_fn = (m_updateTransMat) ? (updated_log_priorProb[stateI]+log(1-decay_factor)) : (log_priorProb[stateI]+log(1-decay_factor));
00592         for(int stateJ = 0; stateJ < numState; stateJ++) {
00593           if (trans_type_stat) {
00594             trans_elem = log_transmat_stat[stateI][stateJ];
00595           } else {
00596             trans_elem = prior_mult_exp_fn;
00597             if(stateJ == stateI) {
00598               trans_elem = ADD_LOG_PROB(trans_elem, log_decay_factor);
00599             }
00600           }
00601           xi_temp[stateI][stateJ] = alpha[stateI][n] + trans_elem + beta[stateJ][n+1] + log_lik_obs[stateJ][n+1];
00602           xi_scale_factor = ADD_LOG_PROB(xi_scale_factor, xi_temp[stateI][stateJ]);
00603         }
00604       }
00605       // scale and sum
00606       for(int stateI = 0; stateI < numState; stateI++) {
00607         for(int stateJ = 0; stateJ < numState; stateJ++) {
00608           xi_temp[stateI][stateJ] -= xi_scale_factor;
00609           xi_sum[stateI][stateJ] = ADD_LOG_PROB(xi_sum[stateI][stateJ], xi_temp[stateI][stateJ]);
00610         }
00611       }
00612     }
00613   } //n
00614   //Verbose::out(3,"CNAnalysisMethodCN::fwdback: max delta between gamma_sum is " + ToStr(max_gamma_sum - min_gamma_sum));
00615 
00616   return fwd_loglik;
00617 }
00618 
00619 /**
00620  * @brief
00621  * @param previous_loglik     - Previous log likelihood.
00622  * @param loglik              - Log likelihood.
00623  * @param emConvergenceThresh - The EM convergence threshold.
00624  * @param bEMconverged        - NOT NEEDED (see todo)
00625  * @return The status of EM convergence.
00626  * @todo Remove the "bEMconverged" parameter since it is not used.
00627  */
00628 bool CNAnalysisMethodCN::EMconverge(
00629     const double             previous_loglik,
00630     const double            loglik,
00631     const double            emConvergenceThresh,
00632     bool                bEMconverged
00633     )
00634 {
00635 
00636   bEMconverged = false;
00637 
00638   // eps: is the distance from 1 -> next larger dbl precision #
00639   // eps is a small number set to 2^-52
00640   double    eps = 2e-52;
00641 
00642   double delta_loglik = fabs(loglik - previous_loglik);
00643   double loglik_avg = 0.5*(fabs(loglik) + fabs(previous_loglik) + eps);
00644 
00645   //Verbose::out(3,"CNAnalysisMethodCN::hmm:EMconverge - Testing for EM convergence... ");
00646   if ( fabs(loglik_avg) !=HUGE_VAL ) {
00647     bEMconverged = (((delta_loglik/loglik_avg) < emConvergenceThresh));
00648   }
00649   //Verbose::out(10,"CNAnalysisMethodCN::hmm:EMconverge - previous_loglik: " + ToStr(previous_loglik) + ", loglik: " + ToStr(loglik)  +  ", emConvergenceThresh " + ToStr(emConvergenceThresh) + ", delta_loglik: " + ToStr(delta_loglik) + ", loglik_avg " + ToStr(loglik_avg) + ", bEMconverged: " + ToStr(bEMconverged));
00650 
00651   return bEMconverged;
00652 }
00653 
00654 /**
00655  * @brief
00656  * @param samplr                - Sample log2 ratios
00657  * @param gamma                 -
00658  * @param gamma_state_sum       -
00659  * @param xi_sum                -
00660  * @param log_transmat_stat     -
00661  * @param updated_log_priorProb - Updated prior probabilities.
00662  * @param updated_mu            - Updated mu.
00663  * @param updated_sigma         - Updated sigma.
00664  * @param compute_obsloglik     -
00665  * @param bEMconverged          -
00666  * @param normalState           - The normal copy number state (user specified).
00667  */
00668 void CNAnalysisMethodCN::reEstimate (
00669     const VecCNLR&                     samplr,
00670     const vector< vector<double> >&     gamma,
00671     const vector<double>&                   gamma_state_sum,
00672     const vector< vector<double> >&     xi_sum,
00673     vector< vector<double> >&             log_transmat_stat,
00674     vector<double>&                           updated_log_priorProb,
00675     vector<double>&                           updated_mu,
00676     vector<double>&                           updated_sigma,
00677     bool&                                   compute_obsloglik,
00678     bool&                        bEMconverged,
00679     int                                     normalState
00680     )
00681 {
00682   int numState = (int)updated_log_priorProb.size(),
00683     numobs = (int)samplr.size();
00684   bool ok_to_update_emat = true;
00685   vector<double> sigma_update(numState,0), mu_update(numState,0), gamma_update(numState,0);
00686 
00687   //Verbose::out(3,"CNAnalysisMethodCN::hmm:reEstimate - Performing re-estimation... ");
00688   //Re-estimate and update the prior
00689   double prior_sum = -FLT_MAX;
00690   if (m_updatePrior) {
00691     for(int stateI = 0; stateI < numState; stateI++) {
00692       updated_log_priorProb[stateI] = gamma[stateI][0];
00693       prior_sum = ADD_LOG_PROB(prior_sum, updated_log_priorProb[stateI]);
00694     }
00695     if(fabs(exp(prior_sum)-1.0)>1e-5) {
00696      // for(int stateI = 0; stateI < numState; stateI++)
00697         //Verbose::out(3,"  Prior[" + ToStr(stateI) + "]\t" + ToStr(updated_log_priorProb[stateI]) + "\n");
00698     }
00699     CNERR_CHECK((fabs(exp(prior_sum)-1)<1e-5),"CNAnalysisMethodCN::hmm:fwdback - Sum of priors: " + ToStr(exp(prior_sum)) + " does not equal 1");
00700   }
00701 
00702 
00703   // Re-estimate & update the emission parameters
00704   if (!m_updateMu || !m_updateSigma) {
00705     compute_obsloglik = false;
00706   }
00707 
00708   if (m_updateMu || m_updateSigma || m_updateTransMat) {
00709     for (int stateI = 0; stateI < numState; stateI++) {
00710       mu_update[stateI] = 0;
00711       sigma_update[stateI] = 0;
00712       for ( int n = 0; n < numobs; n++) {
00713         double weight = exp(gamma[stateI][n] - gamma_state_sum[stateI]);
00714     mu_update[stateI] += weight*samplr[n];
00715     sigma_update[stateI] += weight*((samplr[n] - updated_mu[stateI]) * (samplr[n] - updated_mu[stateI]));
00716       } //numobs
00717       if(sigma_update[stateI] < MIN_SIGMA) {
00718         sigma_update[stateI] = MIN_SIGMA;
00719       }
00720     } // stateI
00721 
00722     // CHECK:  Check for some possible illegal parameter values before making the update.
00723     for (int stateI = 0; stateI < numState; stateI++) {
00724       // The order of mu should always be maintained- sometimes the order can be disrupted on account of negligible datapoints in a given state
00725       if((stateI > 0) && (mu_update[stateI] < mu_update[stateI-1])) {
00726         //Verbose::out(3,"CNAnalysisMethodCN::hmm:reEstimate - mu[" + ToStr(stateI) + "] is less than mu[" + ToStr(stateI-1) + "]");
00727         ok_to_update_emat = false;
00728       }
00729       //Check to ensure updated mu for deletion states do not switch to a positive  value
00730       if((stateI < normalState) && (mu_update[stateI] > updated_mu[normalState])) {
00731         //Verbose::out(3,"CNAnalysisMethodCN::hmm:reEstimate - mu[" + ToStr(stateI) + "] should be less than " + ToStr(updated_mu[normalState]));
00732         ok_to_update_emat = false;
00733       }
00734       //Check to ensure updated mu for amplification states do not switch to negative value
00735       else if ((stateI > normalState) && (mu_update[stateI] < updated_mu[normalState])) {
00736         //Verbose::out(3,"CNAnalysisMethodCN::hmm:reEstimate - mu[" + ToStr(stateI) + "] should be greater than " + ToStr(updated_mu[normalState]));
00737         ok_to_update_emat = false;
00738       }
00739      } //stateI
00740 
00741     compute_obsloglik = ok_to_update_emat;
00742 
00743     //Verbose::out(10,"CNAnalysisMethodCN::hmm:reEstimate - Update Emission Matrix? " + ToStr(ok_to_update_emat));
00744     //Verbose::out(10,"CNAnalysisMethodCN::hmm:reEstimate - Comput_obslik? " + ToStr(compute_obsloglik));
00745 
00746     if (ok_to_update_emat){
00747       for (int stateI = 0; stateI < numState; stateI++) {
00748         if(m_updateMu) {
00749       updated_mu[stateI] = mu_update[stateI];
00750       //Verbose::out(10,"CNAnalysisMethodCN::hmm:reEstimate - Updated Mu: " + ToStr(updated_mu[stateI]));
00751         }
00752         if(m_updateSigma) {
00753       updated_sigma[stateI] = sqrt(sigma_update[stateI]);
00754       //Verbose::out(10,"CNAnalysisMethodCN::hmm:reEstimate - Updated Sigma: " + ToStr(updated_sigma[stateI]));
00755         }
00756       } //stateI
00757     }
00758   } // check update status
00759 
00760 
00761   //NOTE: The non-stationary form gets updated via the prior
00762   //Re-estimate the transition matrix - the stationary form
00763   if ( m_updateTransMat & ok_to_update_emat ) {
00764     for (int stateI = 0; stateI < numState; stateI++) {
00765       // Need to have a gamma sum over all but last element for transmat update
00766       double denominator = SUBTRACT_LOG_PROB(gamma_update[stateI], gamma[stateI][numobs-1]);
00767       for (int stateJ = 0; stateJ < numState; stateJ++) {
00768     log_transmat_stat[stateI][stateJ] = xi_sum[stateI][stateJ] - denominator;
00769            //Verbose::out(10,"CNAnalysisMethodCN::hmm:reEstimate - Updated Stat Transmat: " + ToStr(log_transmat_stat[stateJ][stateI]) + "state : " + ToStr(stateI) + ToStr(stateJ));
00770       } //stateJ
00771     } //stateI
00772   } //update_log_transmat_stat
00773 }
00774 
00775 /**
00776  * @brief
00777  * @param log_lik_obs           -
00778  * @param dist_covariate        -
00779  * @param log_priorProb         -
00780  * @param updated_log_priorProb -
00781  * @param transMatDecay         -
00782  * @param trans_type_stat       -
00783  * @param log_transmat_stat     -
00784  * @param state                 - in/out: CN states.
00785  * @return The logP
00786  */
00787 double CNAnalysisMethodCN::viterbi (
00788         // Inputs
00789     const vector< vector<double> >& log_lik_obs,
00790     const vector<double>&         dist_covariate,
00791     const vector<double>&           log_priorProb,
00792     const vector<double>&            updated_log_priorProb,
00793     const double                    transMatDecay,
00794     const bool                      trans_type_stat,
00795     const vector< vector<double> >& log_transmat_stat,
00796     // Outputs
00797     vector<int>&                    state
00798     )
00799 {
00800   double max_val,
00801   trans_elem,
00802   prior_mult_exp_fn;
00803   int max_id = 0,
00804   numobs  = (int)log_lik_obs[0].size(),
00805   numState = (int)log_lik_obs.size();
00806   vector< vector<double> > delta(numState, vector<double>(numobs));
00807   vector< vector<int> >    psi(numState, vector<int>(numobs));
00808 
00809   //Verbose::out(3,"CNAnalysisMethodCN::hmm:viterbi - Computing Viterbi path... ");
00810   CNERR_CHECK((int)state.size()==numobs, "CNAnalysisMethodCN::viterbi - The number of states does NOT equal the number of observations.");
00811 
00812   // Step 1:Initialization
00813   // Note: log_lik_obs ~ log(emission probability matrix)
00814   for(int stateI = 0; stateI < numState; stateI++) {
00815     delta[stateI][0] = (m_updateTransMat) ? (log_lik_obs[stateI][0] + updated_log_priorProb[stateI]) : (log_lik_obs[stateI][0] + log_priorProb[stateI]);
00816     psi[stateI][0] = max_id;
00817   } //stateI
00818 
00819   // Step 2: Recursion
00820   double log_decay_factor, decay_factor;
00821   for(int n = 1; n < numobs; n++) {
00822     log_decay_factor = -(1/transMatDecay)*dist_covariate[n-1];
00823     decay_factor = exp(log_decay_factor);
00824     for(int stateI = 0; stateI < numState; stateI++) {
00825       prior_mult_exp_fn = (m_updateTransMat) ? (updated_log_priorProb[stateI]+log(1-decay_factor)) : (log_priorProb[stateI]+log(1-decay_factor));
00826       max_id = 0;
00827       // Choose a very small # -Infinity to start w/
00828       max_val = -1 * HUGE_VAL;
00829       for(int stateJ = 0; stateJ < numState; stateJ++) {
00830         if (trans_type_stat) {
00831           trans_elem = log_transmat_stat[stateJ][stateI];
00832         } else {
00833           trans_elem = prior_mult_exp_fn;
00834           if(stateJ == stateI) {
00835             trans_elem = ADD_LOG_PROB(trans_elem, log_decay_factor);
00836           }
00837         }
00838 
00839         double dTMP = delta[stateJ][n-1] + trans_elem;
00840         if ( dTMP > max_val ) {
00841           max_val = dTMP;
00842           max_id = stateJ;
00843         }
00844       } //stateJ
00845       // Save the transition information for later backtracking
00846       psi[stateI][n] = max_id;
00847       // Update delta
00848       delta[stateI][n] = log_lik_obs[stateI][n] + max_val;
00849     } //stateI
00850   }// numobs
00851 
00852   // Step 3: Termination: Determine the final step(stateF) w/ the max probability(logP)
00853   double logP = delta[0][numobs-1];
00854   int stateF = 0;
00855   for(int stateI = 0; stateI < numState; stateI++) {
00856     if ( delta[stateI][numobs-1] > logP ) {
00857       logP = delta[stateI][numobs-1];
00858       stateF = stateI;
00859     } // delta[stateI][numobs-1] > logP
00860   } //stateI
00861 
00862   // Step 4: Path(state sequence) backtracking
00863   state[numobs-1] = stateF;
00864   //Verbose::out(10,"CNAnalysisMethodCN::hmm:viterbi - Observation: " + ToStr(numobs-1) + " state: " + ToStr(state[numobs-1]));
00865   for(int n = numobs-2; n >=0; n--) {
00866     state[n] = psi[state[n+1]][n+1];
00867     // Verbose::out(10,"CNAnalysisMethodCN::hmm:viterbi - Observation: " + ToStr(n) + " state: " + ToStr(state[n]));
00868     if (state[n]==0) {
00869       // Verbose::out(10,"CNAnalysisMethodCN::hmm:viterbi - Observation: " + ToStr(n) + " state: " + ToStr(state[n]));
00870     }
00871   } //numobs
00872 
00873    return logP;
00874 }
00875 
00876 /**
00877  * @brief Performs the CopyNumber algorithm on log2 ratios of a sample on
00878  * a per chromosome basis.
00879  *
00880  * Note:  Currently only states will be used after calling this but in the
00881  *        future this may change.
00882  * @param position            - SNP positions.
00883  * @param samplr              - Sample log2 ratios.
00884  * @param state               - in/out: CN states.
00885  * @param priorProb           - in/out: Prior probabilities.
00886  * @param mu                  - in/out: Mu values.
00887  * @param sigma               - in/out: Sigma values.
00888  * @param transMatDecay       - Transition decay matrix.
00889  * @param stateEstMethod      - State estimation method.
00890  * @param stateMargProb       - State marginal probability (may be modified in future).
00891  * @param emIterations        - Number of EM iterations.
00892  * @param emConvergenceThresh - EM convergence threshold.
00893  * @param b_allelespecific    -
00894  * @param normalState         - The normal copy number state (user specified).
00895  */
00896 void
00897 CNAnalysisMethodCN::hmm(
00898            const vector<int>&  position,
00899            const VecCNLR&               samplr,
00900            vector<int>&                 state,
00901            const vector<double>&        priorProb,
00902            const vector<double>&        mu,
00903            const vector<double>&        sigma,
00904            double                       transMatDecay,
00905            const string&                stateEstMethod,
00906            vector<double>&              stateMargProb,
00907            const unsigned int           emIterations,
00908            const double                 emConvergenceThresh,
00909            bool                         b_allelespecific,
00910            int                          normalState
00911            ) {
00912 
00913 
00914   // Error Handling
00915   CNERR_CHECK(position.size()==samplr.size(),
00916          "CNAnalysisMethodCN::hmm - the number of positions " + ToStr(position.size()) + " does not equal the number of SNPs being evaluated " + ToStr(samplr.size()));
00917   CNERR_CHECK(position.size()==state.size(),
00918          "CNAnalysisMethodCN::hmm - the number of positions " + ToStr(position.size()) + " does not equal the number of SNPs whose states are being evaluated " + ToStr(state.size()));
00919   CNERR_CHECK(priorProb.size()==mu.size(),
00920          "CNAnalysisMethodCN::hmm - the number of states determined from Priors " + ToStr(priorProb.size()) + " and mu " + ToStr(mu.size()) + " do not match");
00921   CNERR_CHECK(priorProb.size()==sigma.size(),
00922          "CNAnalysisMethodCN::hmm - the number of states determined from Priors " + ToStr(priorProb.size()) + " and variance " + ToStr(sigma.size()) + " do not match");
00923   CNERR_CHECK(mu.size()==sigma.size(),
00924          "CNAnalysisMethodCN::hmm - the number of states in the emission matrix components(mu and sigma) do not match; #States(mu): " + ToStr(mu.size()) + " #States(variance)" + ToStr(sigma.size()));
00925   CNERR_CHECK(emIterations>=1,
00926          "CNAnalysisMethodCN::hmm - Number of EM Iterations must be at least 1");
00927 
00928   // Need at least 2datapoints: corresponding to current and prior markers
00929   if (position.size() == 0 ) {
00930     return;
00931   }
00932 
00933   // Initialization
00934   int numState = (int)priorProb.size(),
00935   numobs = (int)samplr.size();
00936   double previous_loglik = -1*HUGE_VAL,
00937   loglik = 0.0,
00938   logP = 0.0;
00939   bool bEMconverged = false,
00940   trans_type_stat = false,
00941   compute_obsloglik=true;
00942   vector< vector<double> > log_lik_obs(numState, vector<double>(numobs)),
00943   alpha(numState, vector<double>(numobs)),
00944   beta(numState, vector<double>(numobs)),
00945   gamma(numState, vector<double>(numobs)),
00946   xi_sum(numState, vector<double>(numState,0)),
00947   log_transmat_stat(numState, vector<double>(numState,-FLT_MAX));
00948   vector<double> dist_covariate(numobs-1,0),
00949   log_priorProb(numState,-FLT_MAX),
00950   updated_log_priorProb(numState,-FLT_MAX),
00951   updated_mu(numState,0),
00952   updated_sigma(numState,0),
00953   gamma_state_sum(numState,0);
00954 
00955   if ( trans_type_stat ) {
00956     CNERR_CHECK((int)m_diagProb.size()==numState,
00957        "CNAnalysisMethodCN::hmm - number of elements in the Diagonal Probability Matrix " + ToStr(m_diagProb.size()) + " does not match number of states in the model " + ToStr(numState));
00958   }
00959 
00960   //Verbose::out(10,"CNAnalysisMethodCN::hmm:Number of EM iterations: " + ToStr(emIterations));
00961 
00962   // Do CN HMM algorithm.
00963   // 0: Initialize the HMM parameters
00964   for (int stateI = 0; stateI < numState; stateI++) {
00965     log_priorProb[stateI] = (priorProb[stateI] > 0) ? log(priorProb[stateI]) : -FLT_MAX;
00966     updated_log_priorProb[stateI] = log_priorProb[stateI];
00967     // For allele specific case
00968     if (b_allelespecific) {
00969       updated_mu[stateI] = mu[stateI] + 1 ;
00970     }
00971     else {
00972       updated_mu[stateI] = mu[stateI];
00973     }
00974     updated_sigma[stateI] = sigma[stateI];
00975     // if stationary transition matrix is preferred:
00976     for (int stateJ = 0; stateJ < numState; stateJ++) {
00977       if(stateJ==stateI) {
00978         log_transmat_stat[stateI][stateJ] = (m_diagProb[stateJ] > 0.0) ? log(m_diagProb[stateJ]) : -FLT_MAX;
00979       } else {
00980         log_transmat_stat[stateI][stateJ] = log(1.0-m_diagProb[stateJ]) - log(numState-1.0);
00981       }
00982     } //stateJ
00983   } //stateI
00984 
00985   // 1: Generate the inter-SNP distance - covariate for non-stationary transition matrix
00986   for(int n = 0; n < (numobs - 1); n++) {
00987     dist_covariate[n] = position[n+1] - position[n];
00988   }
00989 
00990   // EM step
00991   for (int EMiter = 0; EMiter < (int)emIterations; EMiter++) {
00992     //Verbose::out(3,"Performing EM iteration... " + ToStr(EMiter));
00993 
00994     // E Step: 2-3:
00995     // 2: Generate the observed log likelihood(emission probabilities)
00996     if (compute_obsloglik) {
00997       obsloglik(samplr,numState,updated_mu,updated_sigma,log_lik_obs);
00998     }
00999 
01000     // 3: The fwdback computation
01001     loglik = fwdback(dist_covariate,log_priorProb,updated_log_priorProb,log_lik_obs,transMatDecay,trans_type_stat,log_transmat_stat,alpha,beta,gamma,gamma_state_sum,xi_sum,previous_loglik);
01002     //Verbose::out(3,"CNAnalysisMethodCN::hmm:Updated Log Likelihood post fwdback: " + ToStr(loglik));
01003 
01004     if ((EMiter == 0)) {
01005       bEMconverged = (numobs == 1) ? true : false;
01006     } else {
01007       bEMconverged = (numobs == 1) ? true : EMconverge(previous_loglik,loglik,emConvergenceThresh,bEMconverged);
01008       if(loglik < previous_loglik) {
01009         // This shouldn't actually happen, since EM should guarantee a non-decreasing likelihood
01010         //Verbose::out(3,"CNAnalysisMethodCN::hmm: Terminating EM, log likelihood decreased from " + ToStr(previous_loglik) + " to " + ToStr(loglik));
01011         bEMconverged = true;
01012       }
01013     }
01014     previous_loglik = loglik;
01015 
01016     // 5: M step: reEstimation & updates
01017     if (!bEMconverged) {
01018       reEstimate(samplr,gamma,gamma_state_sum,xi_sum,log_transmat_stat,updated_log_priorProb,updated_mu,updated_sigma,compute_obsloglik,bEMconverged,normalState);
01019     } else {
01020       break;
01021     }
01022     //Verbose::out(3,"  CNAnalysisMethodCN::hmm: End of EM iteration " + ToStr(EMiter) + ":");
01023     for (int stateI = 0; stateI < numState; stateI++) {
01024       //Verbose::out(3,"    CNAnalysisMethodCN::hmm:  priorProb[" + ToStr(stateI) + "] is " + ToStr(exp(updated_log_priorProb[stateI])));
01025       //Verbose::out(3,"    CNAnalysisMethodCN::hmm:  mu[" + ToStr(stateI) + "] is " + ToStr(updated_mu[stateI]));
01026       //Verbose::out(3,"    CNAnalysisMethodCN::hmm:  sigma[" + ToStr(stateI) + "] is " + ToStr(updated_sigma[stateI]));
01027     }
01028   }//EMiter
01029 
01030   for (int stateI = 0; stateI < numState; stateI++) {
01031     //Verbose::out(3, "CNAnalysisMethodCN::state:  " + ToStr(stateI) + " - Updated prior probability: " + ToStr(exp(updated_log_priorProb[stateI])) + " - Updated mu: " + ToStr(updated_mu[stateI]) + " - Updated sigma: " + ToStr(updated_sigma[stateI]));
01032   }
01033 
01034   // 6: Selection of optimal path sequence via Viterbi
01035   logP = viterbi(log_lik_obs,dist_covariate,log_priorProb,updated_log_priorProb,transMatDecay,trans_type_stat,log_transmat_stat,state);
01036 
01037   //Verbose::out(3,"Done performing CopyNumber HMM.");
01038 } // CNAnalysisMethodCN::hmm(...)
01039 
01040 
01041 
01042 /**
01043  * @brief Smoothing outliers is done on a per chromosome basis for a given sample.
01044  * @param state      - in/out: CN states.
01045  * @param pos        - Position of SNP: used to compute distances.
01046  * @param distThresh - Distance threshold.
01047  */
01048 void
01049 CNAnalysisMethodCN::smoothOutliers(
01050                   vector<int>&          state,
01051                   const vector<double>& pos,
01052                   double                distThresh
01053                   ) {
01054   //Verbose::out(3,"CopyNumber HMM: Smoothing outliers...");
01055   CNERR_CHECK(state.size()>0,"CNAnalysisMethodCN::smoothOutliers - no states were provided");
01056   CNERR_CHECK(state.size()==pos.size(), "CNAnalysisMethodCN::smoothOutliers - The number of chromosome states (" + ToStr(state.size()) + ") and positions (" + ToStr(pos.size()) + ") don't match");
01057 
01058   unsigned int n = (unsigned int)state.size();
01059   if(n > 1) {
01060     vector<bool> change(n+1);  // change[i] is true if state[i] is different to state[i-1]
01061     vector<double> dist(n+1);  // dist[i] is pos[i]-pos[i-1]
01062     change[0] = change[n] = true;
01063     dist[0] = dist[n] = pos[n-1]-pos[0]+1+distThresh;
01064 
01065     // Pass through once to locate all state transitions
01066     for(unsigned int i=1; i<n; i++) {
01067       dist[i] = pos[i]-pos[i-1];
01068       if(state[i] != state[i-1]) {
01069         change[i] = true;
01070       } else {
01071         change[i] = false;
01072       }
01073     }
01074 
01075     // Pass through a second time to identify states of duration 1 within distThresh of adjacent states.
01076     // Any such states found are assigned to the nearest surrounding state.
01077     vector<int> newstate(n);
01078     for(unsigned int i=0; i<n; i++) {
01079       if(change[i] && change[i+1] && ((dist[i] <= distThresh) || (dist[i+1] <= distThresh))) {
01080         if(dist[i] < dist[i+1]) {
01081           newstate[i] = state[i-1];
01082         } else {
01083           newstate[i] = state[i+1];
01084         }
01085       } else {
01086         newstate[i] = state[i];
01087       }
01088     }
01089 
01090     // Copy final results
01091     for(unsigned int i=0; i<n; i++) {
01092       state[i] = newstate[i];
01093     }
01094   }
01095 
01096   //Verbose::out(3,"CopyNumber HMM: Done Smoothing outliers.");
01097 }
01098 
01099 /**
01100  * @brief This is done across all chromosomes for a given sample.
01101  * The indexes for the "vector< vector<TYPE> >" items are
01102  * [chromosome][state/log2ratio/medianCN/pValue]
01103  * Example:  For chromosome index 2 the 5th log2 ratio values would
01104  * be "samplr[2][4]"
01105  * @param state                      - in/out: CN states.
01106  * @param logRatio                   - Log2 ratios for all SNPs and all chromosomes.
01107  * @param normalState                - The normal copy number state (user specified).
01108  * @param normalStateMinObservations - Minimum number of observations for the normal state.
01109  * @param estCorrectionFactor        -
01110  * @param correctionFactor           -
01111  * @param medianCN                   - Median copy number values for all chromosomes.
01112  */
01113 void
01114 CNAnalysisMethodCN::postProcessHMM(
01115                   const vector< vector<int> >&    state,
01116                   const VecVecCNLR&               logRatio,
01117                   int                             normalState,
01118                       int                             normalStateMinObservations,
01119                   bool                            estCorrectionFactor,
01120                   double&                         correctionFactor,
01121                   VecVecCNLR&                     medianCN
01122                   ) {
01123   //Verbose::out(3,"CopyNumber HMM: Post processing HMM...");
01124   CNERR_CHECK(state.size()==logRatio.size(), "CNAnalysisMethodCN::postProcessHMM - The number of states and log2 ratios don't match");
01125   if(state.size() == 0) {
01126     return;
01127   }
01128 
01129 
01130   //
01131   // Loop over positions in chromosomes to determine segment bounds and
01132   // collect summary statistics per segment from which we can compute
01133   // t-stats etc.
01134   //
01135   unsigned int nChrom = (unsigned int)state.size();
01136   //Verbose::out(10,"CNAnalysisMethodCN::postProcesshmm:# of chromosome processed (nChrom): " + ToStr(nChrom));
01137   //Verbose::out(10,"CNAnalysisMethodCN::postProcesshmm:What is the normal state? " + ToStr(normalState));
01138   //Verbose::out(10,"CNAnalysisMethodCN::postProcesshmm:normalStateMinObservations: " + ToStr(normalStateMinObservations));
01139   //Verbose::out(10,"CNAnalysisMethodCN::postProcesshmm:CorrectionFactor: " + ToStr(correctionFactor));
01140 
01141   vector< vector<int> >    segment_state(nChrom);            // estimated state for each segment
01142   vector< vector<int> >    segment_end_index(nChrom);        // index of first position after end of segment
01143   VecVecCNLR segment_average_x(nChrom);        // the average log ratio for each segment
01144   VecVecCNLR segment_average_xsquared(nChrom); // the average squared log ratio for each segment
01145   VecVecCNLR segment_median(nChrom);           // the median log ratio for each segment
01146 
01147   // The follwoing normal_state variables hold stats relating to
01148   // observations of the normal state across all chromosomes.
01149   VecCNLR normal_state_average(N_NORMAL_SEGMENTS);    // the averages for each normal segment
01150   VecCNLR normal_state_sd(N_NORMAL_SEGMENTS);         // the sds for each normal segment
01151   vector<U_INT> normal_state_nObs(N_NORMAL_SEGMENTS); // the number of SNPs in each normal segment
01152   U_INT normal_state_n=0;                             // the number of normal segments
01153 
01154   for(unsigned int chromIndex=0; chromIndex<nChrom; chromIndex++) {
01155     CNERR_CHECK( state[chromIndex].size()==logRatio[chromIndex].size(),
01156       "CNAnalysisMethodCN::postProcessHMM - The number of snp states and log2 ratios don't match for seq " + ToStr(chromIndex)
01157     );
01158     //Verbose::out(10,"CNAnalysisMethodCN::postProcesshmm:Processing chromsome... " + ToStr(chromIndex));
01159     collect_segment_stats(
01160       state[chromIndex],
01161       logRatio[chromIndex],
01162       normalState,
01163       normalStateMinObservations,
01164       segment_state[chromIndex],
01165       segment_end_index[chromIndex],
01166       segment_average_x[chromIndex],
01167       segment_average_xsquared[chromIndex],
01168       segment_median[chromIndex],
01169       normal_state_average,
01170       normal_state_sd,
01171       normal_state_nObs,
01172       normal_state_n
01173     );
01174   }
01175 
01176   //
01177   // Process collection of all normal copy number state states to
01178   // get a weighted average of the normal copy number state mean and sd,
01179   // which will be used in two-sample t-test measuring significance
01180   //
01181   unsigned int nTotal=0;
01182   for(unsigned int i=0; i<normal_state_n; i++) {
01183     nTotal += normal_state_nObs[i];
01184   }
01185   //Verbose::out(10,"CNAnalysisMethodCN::postProcesshmm: # of normal_state segments "    + ToStr(normal_state_n) + " with nTotal SNPs " + ToStr(nTotal));
01186   double baseline_average = 0;
01187   double baseline_sd = 0;
01188   for(unsigned int i=0; i<normal_state_n; i++) {
01189     double weight = (normal_state_nObs[i]/(double)nTotal);
01190     baseline_average +=  weight * normal_state_average[i];
01191     baseline_sd +=  weight * normal_state_sd[i];
01192   }
01193   //The baseline average & sd reflects the weighted average; where the weighting is based on the #of SNPs per normal segment
01194   //Verbose::out(3,
01195   //  "copyNumber HMM: post processing HMM: normal state (average,sd) are (" + ToStr(baseline_average) +
01196   //  "," + ToStr(baseline_sd) + ") based on " + ToStr(nTotal) + " SNPs in " + ToStr(normal_state_n) + " segments"
01197   //);
01198 
01199   //
01200   // Loop over all chomosomes and all segments to write out t-stats and median log ratio
01201   //
01202   medianCN.resize(nChrom);
01203 //  double term1 = (nTotal > 0) ? baseline_sd * baseline_sd / (double) nTotal : 0;
01204   for(unsigned int chromIndex=0; chromIndex<nChrom; chromIndex++) {
01205     unsigned int nState = (unsigned int)state[chromIndex].size();
01206     medianCN[chromIndex].resize(nState);
01207     unsigned int segIndex,stateIndex;
01208 //  int prev_segment_end_index=0;
01209     for(segIndex=0,stateIndex=0; segIndex< segment_state[chromIndex].size(); segIndex++) {
01210  //     double numerator = segment_average_x[chromIndex][segIndex] - baseline_average;
01211 //      double sd2 = segment_average_xsquared[chromIndex][segIndex] - segment_average_x[chromIndex][segIndex] * segment_average_x[chromIndex][segIndex];
01212 //      int n2 = segment_end_index[chromIndex][segIndex] - prev_segment_end_index;
01213  //     double term2 = sd2 * sd2 / (double) (n2);
01214 //      double denominator = sqrt(term1 + term2);
01215       //Verbose::out(10,"CNAnalysisMethodCN::postProcesshmm: # chromindex: " + ToStr(chromIndex) + " segIndex " + ToStr(segIndex) + " stateIndex " + ToStr(stateIndex));
01216       //Verbose::out(10,"CNAnalysisMethodCN::postProcesshmm: # term1: " + ToStr(term1));
01217       //Verbose::out(10,"CNAnalysisMethodCN::postProcesshmm: # term2: " + ToStr(term2) + " sd2 " + ToStr(sd2) + " n2: " + ToStr(n2));
01218       //Verbose::out(10,"CNAnalysisMethodCN::postProcesshmm: # Numerator: " + ToStr(numerator) + " Denominator: " + ToStr(denominator));
01219       double med = segment_median[chromIndex][segIndex];
01220 
01221       for( ; (int)stateIndex < segment_end_index[chromIndex][segIndex]; stateIndex++) {
01222         medianCN[chromIndex][stateIndex] = (float)med;
01223       }
01224     }
01225   }
01226 
01227   //Verbose::out(3,"copyNumber HMM: Done post processing HMM.");
01228 }
01229 
01230 /**
01231  * @brief Collects segment stats.
01232  * @param state                      - in/out: CN states.
01233  * @param logRatio                   - Log2 ratios for all SNPs and all chromosomes.
01234  * @param normalState                - The normal copy number state (user specified).
01235  * @param normalStateMinObservations - Minimum number of observations for the normal state.
01236  * @param segment_state              -
01237  * @param segment_end_index          -
01238  * @param segment_average_x          -
01239  * @param segment_average_xsquared   -
01240  * @param segment_median             -
01241  * @param normal_state_average       - Normal state log2 ratio average.
01242  * @param normal_state_sd            - Normal state log2 ratio standard deviation.
01243  * @param normal_state_nObs          - Normal state number of observations.
01244  * @param normal_state_n             -
01245  */
01246 void CNAnalysisMethodCN::collect_segment_stats(
01247           const vector<int>&     state,
01248           const VecCNLR&         logRatio,
01249           int                    normalState,
01250           int                    normalStateMinObservations,
01251           vector<int>&           segment_state,
01252           vector<int>&           segment_end_index,
01253           VecCNLR&               segment_average_x,
01254           VecCNLR&               segment_average_xsquared,
01255           VecCNLR&               segment_median,
01256           VecCNLR&               normal_state_average,
01257           VecCNLR&               normal_state_sd,
01258           vector<U_INT>&         normal_state_nObs,
01259           U_INT&                 normal_state_n
01260 ) {
01261   unsigned int nState = (unsigned int)state.size();
01262   segment_state.resize(nState);
01263   segment_end_index.resize(nState);
01264   segment_average_x.resize(nState);
01265   segment_average_xsquared.resize(nState);
01266   segment_median.resize(nState);
01267 
01268   if(nState==0) {
01269     return;
01270   }
01271 
01272   VecCNLR segment_logRatio;       // Buffer for holding logRatios within segment to allow taking medians
01273   segment_logRatio.resize(nState);
01274   unsigned int j;
01275   unsigned int n=0;
01276   int k = 0, prevStateIndex = 0;
01277   for(j=0,k=-1; j<nState; j++) {
01278     if(j==0 || state[j] != segment_state[k]) {
01279       // We're either at the first state, or we just finished a segment
01280       ++k;
01281       segment_state[k] = state[j];
01282       if(k > 0) {  // just finished a segment
01283         prevStateIndex = k-1;
01284         segment_end_index[prevStateIndex] = j;
01285         segment_median[prevStateIndex] = median_in_place(segment_logRatio.begin(),segment_logRatio.begin()+n);
01286         // if the finished segment is a normal state with sufficient observations, record its stats
01287         if((segment_state[prevStateIndex] == normalState) && ((int)n >= normalStateMinObservations)) {
01288           // Check if we need to expand the normal state vectors
01289           if(normal_state_average.size() == normal_state_n) {
01290             unsigned int new_size = (unsigned int) ceil(normal_state_average.size() * N_NORMAL_SEGMENTS_GROWTH_FACTOR);
01291             normal_state_average.resize(new_size);
01292             normal_state_sd.resize(new_size);
01293             normal_state_nObs.resize(new_size);
01294           }
01295           // Write in new normal state stats
01296       //Verbose::out(10,"CNAnalysisMethodCN::postProcesshmm:collect_segment_stats:# of normal states in a segment: " + ToStr(n));
01297           normal_state_average[normal_state_n] = segment_average_x[prevStateIndex];
01298           CNLRT sd = (CNLRT)((segment_average_xsquared[prevStateIndex] - segment_average_x[prevStateIndex] * segment_average_x[prevStateIndex]) * n / (double) (n-1));
01299           normal_state_sd[normal_state_n] = sd;
01300           normal_state_nObs[normal_state_n] = n;
01301           normal_state_n++;
01302         }
01303       }
01304       segment_average_x[k] = logRatio[j];
01305       segment_average_xsquared[k] = logRatio[j] * logRatio[j];
01306       segment_logRatio[0] = logRatio[j];
01307       n=1;
01308     } else {
01309       segment_logRatio[n] = logRatio[j];
01310       ++n;
01311       segment_average_x[k] = (float)(((n-1)*segment_average_x[k]/(double)n) + (logRatio[j]/(double)n));
01312       segment_average_xsquared[k] = (float)(((n-1)*segment_average_xsquared[k]/(double)n) + ((logRatio[j] * logRatio[j])/(double)n));
01313     }
01314   }
01315   // Will have just finished the final segment
01316   prevStateIndex = k;
01317   if((segment_state[prevStateIndex] == normalState) && ((int)n >= normalStateMinObservations)) {
01318     // Check if we need to expand the normal state vectors
01319     if(normal_state_average.size() == normal_state_n) {
01320       unsigned int new_size = (unsigned int) ceil(normal_state_average.size() * N_NORMAL_SEGMENTS_GROWTH_FACTOR);
01321       normal_state_average.resize(new_size);
01322       normal_state_sd.resize(new_size);
01323       normal_state_nObs.resize(new_size);
01324     }
01325     // Write in new normal state stats
01326     normal_state_average[normal_state_n] = segment_average_x[prevStateIndex];
01327     CNLRT sd = (CNLRT)((segment_average_xsquared[prevStateIndex] - segment_average_x[prevStateIndex] * segment_average_x[prevStateIndex]) * n / (double) (n-1));
01328     normal_state_sd[normal_state_n] = sd;
01329     normal_state_nObs[normal_state_n] = n;
01330     normal_state_n++;
01331   }
01332   segment_end_index[prevStateIndex] = j;
01333   segment_median[prevStateIndex] = median_in_place(segment_logRatio.begin(),segment_logRatio.begin()+n);
01334 
01335   ++k;
01336   segment_state.resize(k);
01337   segment_end_index.resize(k);
01338   segment_average_x.resize(k);
01339   segment_average_xsquared.resize(k);
01340   segment_median.resize(k);
01341 
01342   return;
01343 }
01344 
01345 int CNAnalysisMethodCN::getLastAutosomeChromosome()
01346 {
01347     int iLastAutosomeChromosome = 1;
01348     for (int iIndex = 0; (iIndex < (int)getProbeSets()->size()); iIndex++)
01349     {
01350         CNProbeSet* pobjProbeSet = getProbeSets()->at(iIndex);
01351         if (pobjProbeSet->getChromosome() < m_iXChromosome)
01352         {
01353             iLastAutosomeChromosome = Max(iLastAutosomeChromosome, (int)pobjProbeSet->getChromosome());
01354         }
01355     }
01356     return iLastAutosomeChromosome;
01357 }
